parameters.name: Sd
parameters.description: True for a single-ended cut, false for a doubled-ended cut

parameters.name: Flip
parameters.description: True to remove material outside of the profile of the flip side to cut, false to not

parameters.name: Dir
parameters.description: True for Direction 1 to be opposite of the default direction (see Remarks )

parameters.name: T1
parameters.description: Termination type for the first end as defined in swEndConditions_e

parameters.name: T2
parameters.description: Termination type for the second end as defined in swEndConditions_e

parameters.name: D1
parameters.description: Depth of extrusion for the first end in meters

parameters.name: D2
parameters.description: Depth of extrusion for the second end in meters

parameters.name: Dchk1
parameters.description: True allows a draft angle in the first direction, false does not allow drafting in the first direction

parameters.name: Dchk2
parameters.description: True allows a draft angle in the second direction, false does not allow drafting in the second direction

parameters.name: Ddir1
parameters.description: True for the first draft angle to be inward, false to be outward; only valid when Dchk1 is true

parameters.name: Ddir2
parameters.description: True for the second draft angle to be inward, false to be outward; only valid when Dchk2 is true

parameters.name: Dang1
parameters.description: Draft angle for the first end; only valid when Dchk1 is true

parameters.name: Dang2
parameters.description: Draft angle for the second end; only valid when Dchk2 is true

parameters.name: OffsetReverse1
parameters.description: If you chose to offset the first end condition from another face or plane, then true specifies offset in direction away from the sketch, false specifies offset from the face or plane in a direction toward the sketch

parameters.name: OffsetReverse2
parameters.description: If you chose to offset the second end condition from another face or plane, then true specifies offset in direction away from the sketch, false specifies offset from the face or plane in a direction toward the sketch

parameters.name: TranslateSurface1
parameters.description: When you choose swEndConditions_e.swEndCondOffsetFromSurface as the termination type for the first end, then true specifies that the end of the extrusion is a translation of the reference surface, false specifies to use a true offset

parameters.name: TranslateSurface2
parameters.description: When you choose swEndConditions_e.swEndCondOffsetFromSurface as the termination type for the second end, then true specifies that the end of the extrusion is a translation of the reference surface, false specifies to use a true offset

parameters.name: NormalCut
parameters.description: True to create the cut normal to the sheet metal thickness, false to not (only valid for sheet metal parts; use false for non-sheet metal parts)

parameters.name: UseFeatScope
parameters.description: True if the feature only affects selected bodies or components, false if the feature affects all bodies or components

parameters.name: UseAutoSelect
parameters.description: True to automatically select all bodies or components and have the feature affect those bodies or components, false to only select the bodies or components the feature affects (see Remarks )

parameters.name: AssemblyFeatureScope
parameters.description: True if the assembly feature only affects selected components in the assembly, false if the assembly feature affects all components in the assembly

parameters.name: AutoSelectComponents
parameters.description: True to automatically select all affected components, false to use only the selected components

parameters.name: PropagateFeatureToParts
parameters.description: True to propagate the assembly feature to the components in the model that it affects, false to not

parameters.name: T0
parameters.description: Start conditions as defined in swStartConditions_e

parameters.name: StartOffset
parameters.description: If T0 is swStartConditions_e.swStartOffset, then specify an offset value

parameters.name: FlipStartOffset
parameters.description: If T0 is swStartConditions_e.swStartOffset, then true to flip the direction of cut, false to not

parameters.name: OptimizeGeometry
parameters.description: True to optimize the normal cut in a sheet metal part, false to not; only valid for sheet metal parts and when NormalCut is true

parameters.name: Sd
parameters.description: True for a single-ended cut, false for a doubled-ended cut

parameters.name: Flip
parameters.description: True to remove material outside of the profile of the flip side to cut, false to not

parameters.name: Dir
parameters.description: True for Direction 1 to be opposite of the default direction (see Remarks )

parameters.name: T1
parameters.description: Termination type for the first end as defined in swEndConditions_e

parameters.name: T2
parameters.description: Termination type for the second end as defined in swEndConditions_e

parameters.name: D1
parameters.description: Depth of extrusion for the first end in meters

parameters.name: D2
parameters.description: Depth of extrusion for the second end in meters

parameters.name: Dchk1
parameters.description: True allows a draft angle in the first direction, false does not allow drafting in the first direction

parameters.name: Dchk2
parameters.description: True allows a draft angle in the second direction, false does not allow drafting in the second direction

parameters.name: Ddir1
parameters.description: True for the first draft angle to be inward, false to be outward; only valid when Dchk1 is true

parameters.name: Ddir2
parameters.description: True for the second draft angle to be inward, false to be outward; only valid when Dchk2 is true

parameters.name: Dang1
parameters.description: Draft angle for the first end; only valid when Dchk1 is true

parameters.name: Dang2
parameters.description: Draft angle for the second end; only valid when Dchk2 is true

parameters.name: OffsetReverse1
parameters.description: If you chose to offset the first end condition from another face or plane, then true specifies offset in direction away from the sketch, false specifies offset from the face or plane in a direction toward the sketch

parameters.name: OffsetReverse2
parameters.description: If you chose to offset the second end condition from another face or plane, then true specifies offset in direction away from the sketch, false specifies offset from the face or plane in a direction toward the sketch

parameters.name: TranslateSurface1
parameters.description: When you choose swEndConditions_e.swEndCondOffsetFromSurface as the termination type for the first end, then true specifies that the end of the extrusion is a translation of the reference surface, false specifies to use a true offset

parameters.name: TranslateSurface2
parameters.description: When you choose swEndConditions_e.swEndCondOffsetFromSurface as the termination type for the second end, then true specifies that the end of the extrusion is a translation of the reference surface, false specifies to use a true offset

parameters.name: NormalCut
parameters.description: True to create the cut normal to the sheet metal thickness, false to not (only valid for sheet metal parts; use false for non-sheet metal parts)

parameters.name: UseFeatScope
parameters.description: True if the feature only affects selected bodies or components, false if the feature affects all bodies or components

parameters.name: UseAutoSelect
parameters.description: True to automatically select all bodies or components and have the feature affect those bodies or components, false to only select the bodies or components the feature affects (see Remarks )

parameters.name: AssemblyFeatureScope
parameters.description: True if the assembly feature only affects selected components in the assembly, false if the assembly feature affects all components in the assembly

parameters.name: AutoSelectComponents
parameters.description: True to automatically select all affected components, false to use only the selected components

parameters.name: PropagateFeatureToParts
parameters.description: True to propagate the assembly feature to the components in the model that it affects, false to not

parameters.name: T0
parameters.description: Start conditions as defined in swStartConditions_e

parameters.name: StartOffset
parameters.description: If T0 is swStartConditions_e.swStartOffset, then specify an offset value

parameters.name: FlipStartOffset
parameters.description: If T0 is swStartConditions_e.swStartOffset, then true to flip the direction of cut, false to not

parameters.name: OptimizeGeometry
parameters.description: True to optimize the normal cut in a sheet metal part, false to not; only valid for sheet metal parts and when NormalCut is true

remarks:
The default direction for:
cut operations is opposite the sketch normal.
boss operations is along the sketch normal.
Setting the direction parameters to true reverses the default direction. For double-ended extrusions, Direction 2 is always opposite to Direction 1.
The default sketch normal is the face or plane that is perpendicular to the sketch plane. To determine the sketch normal, see
IFace2::Normal
and
IRefPlane::Transform
.
When UseAutoSelect is false, the user must select the bodies that the feature will affect.
When using cut or cavity features that result in multiple bodies, you cannot select to keep all of the resulting bodies or one or more selected bodies.
